forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. Southwest wind 5 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight descends upon Downtown San Francisco, a veil of rain wraps the city, blurring outlines and lending a somber charm to the evening. The air, tinged with a damp chill, ushers in temperatures dipping to about fifty-one degrees. The southwest wind whispers softly yet persistently, rustling the leaves and carrying the unmistakable scent of impending showers. The forecast warns of an eighty percent chance of rain, with drizzles expected to amass in delicate fractions, hardly enough to act as a deterrent for those with a penchant for city walks under an umbrella.

Tomorrow, a palette of muted grays persists, as remnants of today’s rain linger. The sky will remain mostly cloudy, with temperatures stalling around fifty-eight degrees and easing into a slightly cooler afternoon. The likelihood of more rain, at seventy percent, complements the city’s atmospheric canvas, while gusts may provoke an energetic flutter in the breeze, reminding everyone of nature’s transient character. Given this backdrop, perhaps a cozy evening indoors is in order—an exploration of a local café, indulging in warm drinks and good conversation, or perhaps an intimate bookstore to get lost in a world of stories, as the soothing sound of droplets provides a rhythmic backdrop to the night.
